Articles.Content:
Inspired by a real-life experimental, 1-man emergency re-entry capsule (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MOOSE), I decided to work on safe re-entry without a command pod. After a few major versions, and dozens of minor fixes between major reworks, I came up with this. I call it the Lifeboat-MK2.

http://imgur.com/a/vvzPh

Anyways, this version is a resounding success, which is a huge relief after 12 deaths and who knows how many aborts even beginning the test. A fully fueled Lifeboat weighs 1.5 tons, empty its about 1.3. This is much lighter than a conventional 3-man pod and de-orbit RCS module, which weighs in around 5 tons. Too bad this pod only holds two people. Plus, the ride is an absolutely terrifying, white-knuckled one-way trip. The pod has so little fuel, once you board it, you're committed. No going back.

My next version will hold 3, so I can "save" a whole crew in one go.
